  • SEARCH: 
 

BASEMAPS web application manages different geographical services provided by source URL.

The application is written in Java 1.8, is running on Tomcat (9.0) or any other similar servlet container server. Database of Postgres 9.6 is required and BASEMAPS is using Hibernate to connect to the database.

The main interaction and data exchange is done by http requests and responses and available methods can be found in controllers package (fi.fta.controllers). The application uses two kinds of beans (object wrappers): database or model beans, and user interface beans (JSON), most of them have their alternatives in both packages and the fields might slightly differ. Usually they can be converted between one kind to another by constructors and do not need special tools. Data beans are managed by data managers (fi.fta.data.managers), where business logics is applied and also saved or updated to database by data access objects (fi.fta.data.dao). User interface wrappers are used for exposig data to application users.

After users provide a new data service, the application parses it from remote source and saves to the database. The application requires separate parse helper for each kind of service (fi.fta.utils.parse, fi.fta.utils.parse.wms, fi.fta.utils.parse.wfs), helpers use version specifications to get the correct data from remote service. In order to extract more data from the service, the description of new fields must be added to all specifications.

Packages 
Package Description
fi.fta.beans
The package contains all the beans used in business model and many of them are linked to database entities (tables).
fi.fta.beans.response
Wrapper beans for exchanging data between server and front-end (JSON)
fi.fta.beans.ui
JSON data wrappers.
fi.fta.cache
Application caching objects, structures, that hold cache mechanisms.
fi.fta.controllers
Spring controllers managing web requests and giving responses.
fi.fta.core
Application servlet objects
fi.fta.data.dao
Data access objects.
fi.fta.data.managers
Different data managers.
fi.fta.filters
Objects for filtering lists.
fi.fta.mail
Manages all application mailing when connected to any mail server.
fi.fta.model
Object helpers for web application model.
fi.fta.utils
General utils for various applications tasks, as managing strings, dates, math, beans and others.
fi.fta.utils.generation
Utils for generating js data to front end from java resources.
fi.fta.utils.parse
Utils for parsing different XML resources.
fi.fta.utils.parse.wfs
Helper utils for parsing WFSes from their XML resources.
fi.fta.utils.parse.wms
Helper utils for parsing WMSes from their XML resources.
fi.fta.utils.profile
Convenience objects when profiling any application task.
fi.fta.utils.translation
Utils for translating text between particular languages
fi.fta.validation
Server validators for user input values.
fi.fta.velocity
Velocity templates managing objects.
fi.fta.ws.security
Convenience objects for managing required java certificates.
